name: sspirial.systems
tagline: a microstudio for tiny, strange, African-centric digital inventions
description: A playful laboratory creating experimental digital tools and prototypes. Curious, inventive, African-centric.

philosophy.title: Small is powerful
paragraphs: Big software tries to do everything. Small software does one thing so well you can't imagine life without it. We build the latter.
Small tools are easier to understand, easier to trust, and easier to fix when they break. They respect your time and your device's resources.

philosophy.title: Scarcity is not a problem to solve
paragraphs: Most software assumes abundance: fast internet, powerful devices, unlimited data. We assume scarcity: intermittent connectivity, shared devices, limited battery.
Designing for scarcity isn't settling for less. It's finding elegance in constraint. It's making software that works for billions, not just millions.

philosophy.title: African-centric by default
paragraphs: Most tech is built for Silicon Valley and adapted (poorly) for everyone else. We flip that. We design for African contexts first: multilingual users, cash-based economies, communal device usage.
This isn't tokenism. It's strategy. If your tool works in Lagos, Nairobi, or Kigali, it'll work anywhere.

philosophy.title: Offline first, always
paragraphs: Connectivity is a luxury. Your software shouldn't stop working when the network does. Build for offline by default. Sync when possible, but never depend on it.
Offline-first isn't a technical choice‚Äîit's a political one. It says: your data, your device, your control.

philosophy.title: Experiment loudly
paragraphs: Most companies hide their failures. We share ours. Prototypes that didn't work. Ideas that flopped. Lessons learned the hard way.
Innovation isn't about getting it right the first time. It's about trying, failing, learning, and sharing what you learned.

philosophy.title: Craft over scale
paragraphs: We're not building unicorns. We're not chasing growth at all costs. We're making things we're proud of, at a pace that's sustainable.
We'd rather serve 1,000 people exceptionally well than 1,000,000 people poorly.

philosophy.title: Open by default
paragraphs: Our code, our process, our lessons‚Äîmost of it is open. Not because we're saints, but because good ideas compound when shared.
Open source isn't charity. It's collaboration. It's betting that collective intelligence beats proprietary secrets.

philosophy.title: User agency over engagement
paragraphs: We don't optimize for "time spent in app." We optimize for user control. Our tools should serve you, not trap you.
Good software gets out of your way. It empowers you to do what you came to do, then lets you leave.

philosophy.title: Beauty in simplicity
paragraphs: Minimalism isn't about removing features until there's nothing left. It's about removing everything that distracts from the essential.
Elegant code. Clear interfaces. Thoughtful interactions. Software can be functional and beautiful. We insist on both.
